text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bahraini press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- More than 8,000 families received social insurance in the first half of 1996.
- Bahrain's gross domestic product rose to $4.36 billion in 1995 from about $4.30 billion in 1994.
- Interior Minister Sheikh Mohammad says will develop various ministry installations to provide more security for citizens.
- Construction of a third causeway linking Mina Salman with the proposed new port in Hidd to start next year.
- Health care set for a new era. Bahrain plans to build two new health centres at a cost of 2.5 million dinars.
- 300 to attend key banking conference in Bahrain on October 27.
- More efforts urged to care for elderly.
